DataElement.preferredName: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act Tissue Donor Authorization Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date that a Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) authorization was obtained from someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act Tissue Donor Authorization
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) authorization from someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Public Law 104-91, enacted in 1996, is designed to protect health insurance coverage for workers and their families when they change or lose their jobs. HIPAA has separate provisions for the large and small group markets, and the individual market. HIPAA amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA), the Public Health Service Act, and the Internal Revenue Code to provide improved portability and continuity of health insurance coverage, extending earlier provisions under the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 ("COBRA").

Concepts.longName: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
Concepts.definition: United States legislation enacted in 1996 that aims to provide health data privacy and security.

Property.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:Decision of the competent authorities in form of a letter, document, or verbal or electronic form, that confirms that somebody has permission to do something or be somewhere, e.g. to realize a given project.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Decision of the competent authorities in form of a letter, document, or verbal or electronic form, that confirms that somebody has permission to do something or be somewhere, e.g. to realize a given project.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
